lead_paragraph: With Donald J. Trump winning seven more states, Republican rivals grasped for hope that they could defy history and halt his march to the nomination.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel, Matt Flegenheimer and Alexander Burns contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.print_headline: Anti-Trump Republicans Move to Deny Nomination
headline.main: ‘Never Trump’ Movement Dealt Setback After Super Tuesday

snippet: With Donald J. Trump winning seven more states, Republican rivals grasped for hope that they could defy history and halt his march to the nomination.
abstract: Group of corporate executives, financiers and Republican strategists have begun assault on Donald J Trump in wake of his victories on Super Tuesday, investing millions of dollars on television attack ads in Florida before state's primary; effort comes as party leaders express alarm about what Trump would do to Republican party's prospects and image if he becomes presidential nominee.
